description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ao0bp","text":"How to make P5ARP and P10ARP media plates, simplified from https://wiki.bugwood.org/PARP_or_PARP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":59,"length":37}],"data":{}},{"key":"6hcff","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aup91","text":"Contains: pimarcin, ampicillin, rifampicin, pentachloronitrobenzens. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asug9","text":"Pimaricin is a broad-spectrum antifungal antibiotic that inhibits the true fungi but not most members of the Pythiaceae. Once in solution, it is inactivated by light so that culture plates must be stored and incubated in the dark. Growth of true fungi indicates the inactivation of pimaricin. Concentrations above 10 mg a.i./liter inhibit oospore germination of Pythium and Phytophthora","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cu9tp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fv47","text":"Plates will last for 1-1.5 weeks before antibiotics are degraded.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"DF67B6420EF211EEB7290A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://wiki.bugwood.org/PARP_or_PARP_H_(modified)"}}}}

see safety notes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b3ve","text":"Petri dishes (90 or 60 mm)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqsuh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4h9m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftf4c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2skgn","text":"Equipment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dufd","text":"1.5 or 2L Erlenmeyer flask","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82bg4","text":"Stir plate and bars","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqav","text":"Fine weigh scale","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"de43b","text":"Autoclave and materials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv7ln","text":"Hot water bath","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"513gi","text":"Biosafety Hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3bbo","text":"Ethanol (80%)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bb59","text":"1 L media bottles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdcl3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1glvi","text":"Add   of Difco cornmeal agar to each   Erlenmeyer flask","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":37,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"71uhv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"17","error":false,"guid":"E9A1C9400EF311EEB1425F31DA7E7FAC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"FC7AEBA00EF311EEB1425F31DA7E7FAC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8d4ka","text":"Add RO water to   line (pre-measure line and mark with sharpie or use a graduated cylinder).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"13e9v","text":"Cover top with foil so that at least 2\" of foil is below flask lip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fas5e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1000","error":false,"guid":"0ABEA7600EF411EEB1425F31DA7E7FAC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8t9u0","text":"Add stir bar and mix well over stir plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4temd","text":"Autoclave media in flask alongside 1 L media bottle (loosely capped), for 20 minutes on liquid cycle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"rrm7","text":"Turn on hot water bath and set to  . {"blocks":[{"key":"7ogmm","text":"Prepare hood by wiping down with 80% EtOH and labeling Petri dishes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fqs7e","text":"Prepare rifampicin solution:   rifampicin dissolved in   DMSO in a microcentrifuge tube. {"blocks":[{"key":"aom3r","text":"Check temperature of hot water bath (between   to  ).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":45,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4itvi","text":"Place sterilized basal media in hot water bath and wait for temperature to decrease target range. {"blocks":[{"key":"555pt","text":"Refill with remaining media and dispense into Petri dishes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1d6jc","text":"Immediately fill empty bottle with tap water when finished so that agar does not dry on glass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51egp","text":"Mark plates with a single red bar using a Sharpie. Attach lab tape with date and your initials to stack of plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5vljq","text":"When agar has solidified (8-24h), place back into sleeves and label bottom outside of bag with date made and your initials.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9ljde","text":"Store in fridge as soon as possible to preserve the antibiotics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
